page.title: List of James Bond henchmen in Dr. No

rev.diff:
Line 152: Line 152:
[[pl:Doktor No - henchmani]]
[[pl:Doktor No - henchmani]]
â   â   â
Ziv
  â
Affiliation: Dr. No
  â
Status: deceased
  â
portrayed by: Milton Reid
  â   â
Ziv is a fictional character in the James Bond film Dr. No portrayed by Milton Reid
  â   â
Ziv is one of Dr. No's guards and although there are several he's the most frequently-seen. It's likely that he's mute although this is never proven. His exact role is also unknown although since he's never seen outside of Dr. No's lair it's generally believed that he's either Dr. No's bodyguard or chief-of-security. He's also rather infrequently-seen only appearing in 3 scenes in the film.
  â   â
Ziv first appears when Professor R. J. Dent goes to Dr. No's lair and speaks with the doctor despite it being daylight. Ziv is seen guiding Dent through the outside balcony and later letting him in. Here he looks slightly angry hinting that he's extremely loyal to Dr. No which is further proven.
  â   â
He appears much later in the film next to Dr. No when the doctor has dinner with James Bond and Honey Ryder. Here he doesn't speak and is seen in the doorway and is seen standing at the side of the room with a blank stare although since some time passed it's unknown if he partaked in the dinner. When No orders Honey to be taken away Ziv has another unnamed guard do so and when No orders the same be done to Bond it's shown that he's also quite strong as he quickly beats Bond into unconsciousness with his bare fists.
  â   â
In the next scene he appears in we find out how loyal Ziv is to No as when the lair is beginning to explode because Bond overheated the reactor instead of trying to flee Ziv is still guarding Honey like No ordered him. When Bond gets into the room Honey's captured in Ziv tries to stop Bond although this backfires when Bond just simply punches Ziv across the face. This punch sends Ziv falling down onto the concrete floor (they were on a stairwell) head-first presumably bashing it in killing him. However it's equally likely that it just knocked Ziv unconscious and if that's the case than he's definitely deceased since if he's simply unconscious he would have still gotten incinerated when No's lair exploded.
  â   â
Alphonse
  â
Affiliation: Dr. No
  â
Status: deceased
  â
portrayed by: Bob Simmons
  â   â
Alphonse is a fictional character in the film Dr. No portrayed by Bob Simmons.
  â   â
When Dr. No's scanners pick up James Bond, Honey Ryder and Quarrel on their scanners a search party is sent out with Alphonse leading it. He warns them to come out and has Nick shoot a machine gun as a warning and eventually try to kill them. When they still refuse to come out he yells, "All right hide. But we'll return. We'll return with the dogs."
  â   â
Since the machine gun destroyed Honey's and Bond's respective rafts they flee into the local swampland whilst indeed Alphonse (who is now toting a machine gun) and a small search party do return with some bloodhounds. Upon hearing the dogs barking Bond cleverly throws his wallet towards the forest on the other side of the swamp they're in before he, Honey and Quarrel hide underwater and use sticks to breath. The bloodhound's fall for the ruse since the scent there is stronger than if Bond's underwater and thus run off towards the forest.
  â   â
Alphonse is still somewhat suspicious though and thus whilst the rest of the search party follow the bloodhounds run off through the woods Alphonse goes wading into the pond with his machine gun in hand. When he goes pass the overhang Bond, Honey and Quarrel are hiding under Bond takes Honey's knife and slits Alphonse's throat.
  â   â
Nick
  â
Affiliation: Dr. No
  â
Status: presumed deceased
  â
portrayed by: Robert Rietty
  â   â
Nick is a fictional character in the film Dr. No portrayed by Robert Riett (who also voiced John Strangways earlier in the film).
  â   â
Nick is at first a member of Alphonse's search party and is the one who fired the machine gun that destroyed Bond's and Honey's rafts. His role is presumably that of Alphonse's second-in-command since he takes over the search party upon Alphonse's death.
  â   â
When Alphonse's corpse if found in the swamp he becomes aware that James Bond, Honey Ryder and Quarrel are indeed on the island of Crab Key. Thus he recruits Mitch to find the trio in Dr. No's dragon tank. After killing Quarrel he and Nick capture Bond and Honey and bring them back to No's lair where they're given a decontamination shower by Yip while he leaves the room. Here he beats Bond with a club and when Sister Rose later asks Bond, "How do you like your peers here?" to which Bond sarcastically quips, "Given the chance I'll leave Mitch and kill Nick," presumably because Nick gave him a brutal clubbing.
  â   â
Indeed later when Bond overheats Dr. No's reactor Nick is among those who try to flee rather than fight Bond (actually Ziv is the only person who tries to fend off Bond). When Bond and Honey hop onto a motorboat whilst fleeing the doomed lair Nick is already onboard and recognizing him Bond attacks the evil man. At Honey's urging since the reactor is going to blow any second Bond simply punches Nick's lights out and throws him overboard. The film ends before his final fate is revealed although it's safe to say that since he's unconscious he drowned underwater.
  â   â
Mitch
  â
Affiliation: Dr. No
  â
Status: unknown
  â
portrayed by: Byron Lee
  â   â
Mitch is a fictional character in the James Bond film Dr. No portrayed by Byron Lee (who also played Puss-Feller's singer earlier in the film).
  â   â
Mitch isn't once until very late in the film when he and Nick emerge from Dr. No's dragon tank. He's apparently the soft-spoken type since when they capture James Bond and Honey Ryder, Nick clubs Bond and although Mitch is obviously disgusted as evidenced by him flinching and the disgusted look on his face he doesn't interfere. After leaving Bond with Yip he isn't seen until later. Unlike Nick who brutally clubbed Bond the secret agent doesn't seem to harbor a grudge against Mitch as evidenced when Sister Rose asks Bond, "How do you like your peers here?" Bond says, "Given the chance I'll leave Mitch and kill Nick."
  â   â
Mitch is briefly seen near the ending of the film when Bond overheats the reactor in Dr. No's lair thus causing it to self-destruct eventually. When the scene goes to the balcony outside he is seen diving over the side into the water so as to avoid dying. The film ends before his final fate is revealed although it's possible he survived provided the fact he could swim away in time.
  â   â
Yip
  â
Affiliation: Dr. No
  â
Status: unknown
  â
portrayed by: Anthony Chinn
  â   â
Yip is a fictional character in the James Bond film Dr. No portrayed by Anthony Chinn.
  â   â
Yip is credited as decontamination technician and indeed he is the operator of the decontamination shower James Bond and Honey Ryder take upon their entrance to Dr. No's lair. After reducing their radioactivity level to 0% he hands them over to Sister Lily and Sister Rose.
  â   â
He is later seen in Dr. No's control room with No and Bock operating the controls with the other 2. When Bond overheats the reactor and everyone in the lair evacuates the 2 come across each other in the halls. Although Bond asks him where to find Honey he says he doesn't know although oddly unlike Bock whom Bond also asked Bond spares Yip. Why he did this is unknown although it's most likely because although Yip with No he did help Bond and didn't do anything bad to him. In return Yip tells Bond that only secretaries keep track of who's in what room which helps Bond. Whether or not Yip escaped the lair before it exploded is unknown.
  â   â
Bock
  â
Affiliation: Dr. No
  â
Status: deceased
  â
portrayed by: John Hatton
  â   â
Bock is a fictional character in the James Bond film Dr. No portrayed by John Hatton (who portrayed a radio operator earlier in the film and it's apparent that Hatton just put on an Asian mask to switch roles).
  â   â
Bock appears alongside Dr. Julius No and Yip in the control room where Dr. No's operation is underway and is the one who points out Bond (under his and No's false belief that he's Chang). While Yip is seen doing little else other than pushing buttons he's the one who asks people for their positions. When Bond overheats the reactor Bock is among the first people to flee the control room.
  â   â
Later when Bond is looking for his girlfriend Honey Ryder's cell he comes across Bock who's just taking off his radioactivity suit. Bond grabs him by the collar and asks him for Honey's wheareabouts which he denies any info about and so Bond punches him in the cheek knocking Bock unconscious. Bond later gets help from Yip and one of the secretaries. Although Bond punching him in the cheek likely didn't kill him he's definitely dead since if he's unconscious he wouldn't have escaped No's lair before it exploded.
  â   â
Xavier
  â
Affiliation: Dr. No
  â
Status: deceased
  â
portrayed by: William Foster-Davis
  â   â
Xavier is a fictional character in the James Bond film Dr. No portrayed by William Foster-Davis (who portrayed Superintendant Duff in the same film which is obvious since they're both portly).
  â   â
Xavier appears in Dr. No's control room where unlike other people in the same room who's radioactivity suits are white jumpsuits or something like that his body is simply covered in plastic. He's also apparently mute since Chang reports what going on at his station. When Bond (disguised as Chang) goes to Xavier's station whilst Xavier looks at his clipboard Bond overheats the reactor by increasing the radiation level.
  â   â
When Xavier hears the loud hum that is coming from the overheated reactor he attacks Bond although the agent quickly knocks Xavier down which alerts No to Bond's presence. Xavier gets up a second time only for Bond to kick Xavier against the metal railing snapping his spine and then he falls down the nearby stairwell head-first into the concrete floor. Although it's unknown if this killed him (although it most likely did) he's defnitely dead since it would've knocked him unconscious in any case which would then cause him to die when the lair exploded from the overheated reactor.
  â   â
Chang
  â
Affiliation: Dr. No
  â
Status: deceased
  â
portrayed by: Anthony Chinn
  â   â
Chang is a fictional character in the James Bond film Dr. No portrayed by Anthony Chinn (who also portrays Yip in the same film).
  â   â
Chang only appears in one scene when Bond escapes his cell Chang returns from going to the bathroom and is putting on his suit so as to enter Dr. No's operation room. Bond however strangles Chang to death and then steals his radioactive suit allowing him to pose as the dead man. Although he never had any dialogue it's stated that he can talk since his partner Xavier is obviously mute and Bock asked him for how the radiation level is working out.
